intro: Jaegeria crassa, commonly known as the broad-leaved jaegeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in dense clusters at the ends of the stems. Jaegeria crassa is often found in moist, sunny habitats such as grasslands and forest edges.
